document.title: SP461C Finding Work - Preparing a Resume

author.organization: The University of Tennessee Agricultural Extension Service

document.abstract:
A resume is a summary of your experiences, skills and accomplishments. The resume includes more detailed information than a letter of application. Ideally, it should make you and your attributes stand out in a positive way for an employer and show how you are different from the rest of the applicants. It is one way to get invited to a job interview.

Remember, the main purpose of a resume is to obtain a job interview. Therefore, your summary of relevant paid and non-paid work experiences, marketable skills and education should be written in terms of the prospective employerâ€™s needs. The resume should relate your skills and accomplishments to the requirements of the job offered by the employer.
